title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

10:14 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <+sburjan> vmassol: we should update the JBoss page because IMO the 4.0 release is very old. Current stable is 6.0 and they already published 7.0 beta 3  
10:30 <vmassol> sburjan: sure go ahead  
10:30 <vmassol> personally I don't have experience with it so I cannot update it  
10:30 <vmassol> this page wasn't written by us btw  
10:30 <+sburjan> I'll try to see if the tutorial works for version 6.0  
10:31 <vmassol> ok  
10:33 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I was able to make EditObjectTest.testEmptyGroupObjects() fail once after running it more than 400 times (I couldn't make it fail twice though)  
10:33 <vmassol> in the logs I got:  
10:33 <vmassol> 2011-05-02 17:44:17,506 [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/edit/Test/EditObjectsTestObject?xpage=editobject&xaction=addObject&className=Test.EditObjectsTestClass] WARN  doc.XWikiDocument               - Failed to display field [prop] in [view] mode for Object of Class [xwiki:Test.EditObjectsTestObject]  
10:33 <vmassol> java.lang.NullPointerException  
10:33 <vmassol>         at com.xpn.xwiki.objects.classes.DBListClass.displayView(DBListClass.java:584)  
10:33 <vmassol>         at com.xpn.xwiki.doc.XWikiDocument.display(XWikiDocument.java:2907)  
10:33 <vmassol>         at com.xpn.xwiki.doc.XWikiDocument.display(XWikiDocument.java:2868)  
10:33 <vmassol>         at com.xpn.xwiki.doc.XWikiDocument.display(XWikiDocument.java:2817)  
10:33 <vmassol>         at com.xpn.xwiki.doc.XWikiDocument.display(XWikiDocument.java:2794)  
10:33 <vmassol>         at com.xpn.xwiki.api.Document.display(Document.java:1205)  
10:33 <vmassol> I'm still not sure why this happened  
10:34 <sdumitriu> has quit  
10:34 <vmassol> btw lots of tests are failing now: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/596/testReport/ after I made a change but I don't understand why. Maybe a stray XE instance was leftover or osmething liek that  
10:36 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I also see this: "There are more SCM polling activities scheduled than handled, so the threads are not keeping up with the demands. http://ci.xwiki.org/descriptor/hudson.triggers.SCMTrigger/." on http://ci.xwiki.org/manage  
10:37 <vmassol> going to uprgade to 1.410

12:07 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
12:27 <@cjdelisle> I don't seem to have a username with ow2, is there something I'm missing?  
12:28 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: did you created an account ?  
12:29 <@cjdelisle> On ow2? No, I wasn't sure if it based on committer name etc. Is that all I have to do to be able to push?  
12:30 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: there is no link between ow2 and github or even XWiki svn server so yes you have to have a ow2 account  
12:46 <@cjdelisle> got the ow2 account, do I need some additional magic?  
12:46 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: you need to put you public ssh key on ow2 to scp stuff on it  
12:47 <+tmortagne> checking if you need some specific right  
12:48 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: what is your user id ono ow2 ?  
12:48 <+tmortagne> s/ono/on/  
12:48 <@cjdelisle> Caleb\_James\_DeLisle  
12:48 <+tmortagne> "User does not exist."  
12:49 <+tmortagne> I need what ow2 calls your "Unix Name"  
12:49 <@cjdelisle> hmm they must have another login because I logged in through their wiki interface  
12:50 <@cjdelisle> the one on the front page  
12:50 <+tmortagne> you need to regoster on http://forge.ow2.org don't know if it's the same  
12:50 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
12:50 <+tmortagne> s/\*regoster/register/  
12:53 <@cjdelisle> hahaha that was easy, somehow I ended up doing the one that demanded a ton of information and huge agreement  
12:53 <@cjdelisle> cjdelisle  
12:55 <+tmortagne> hmm should be ok now I think  
12:55 <+tmortagne> ow2 admin is not very clear...  
13:01 <@cjdelisle> thanks, working now  
13:04 <vmassol> ok found the regression I introduced in the test fwk, fixing now  
13:07 <@cjdelisle> "There are more SCM polling activities scheduled than handled" This is likely because I made a bunch of changes then pushed them all at once.  
13:08 <@cjdelisle> M1 should not be building anymore since I disabled the build. It ran a test once but it should not test anymore either unless someone commits to the M1 branch which is rather silly at this point.  
13:08 <vmassol> well it got triggered earlier today  
13:08 <vmassol> maybe it was you who did that manually?  
13:08 <vmassol> can we remove it from hudson?  
13:08 <vmassol> s/hudson/jenkins/  
13:09 <vmassol> we'll need to clean it up from our remote repo too at some point since I'm not sure it'll get removed  
13:09 <vmassol> (we need to check our nexus rules)  
13:09 <@cjdelisle> Or at least disable it. The results of the test might be interesting since it tested the actual release.  
13:09 <vmassol> I don't think it's sueful since we have the trunks build now  
13:09 <vmassol> which is where any failing tests should be fixed  
13:10 <@cjdelisle> I'm thinking about the list of failing tests from an informational standpoint IE "these are tests which failed on the released version"  
13:11 <vmassol> I need to prepare a mail but in the end I think that releasing on a branch is too complex for the benefit we get (it was good to try it)  
13:11 <vmassol> cjdelisle: then we should put those in the release notes  
13:11 <vmassol> but honestly I don't rhink it matters  
13:11 <vmassol> what matters is to put any regression we know of  
13:11 <vmassol> (in the RN)  
13:14 <@cjdelisle> re branch for release. With git, another way to do it is to release from the local repository then push the tags and reset the commits on trunk.  
13:26 <vmassol> bbl  
13:55 <mflorea> has quit  
13:56 <+sburjan> vmassol: FYI I have started porting CommentTest  
13:59 <mpaun> has joined #xwiki  
13:59 <@cjdelisle> I'm getting 404s from ow2 when trying to d/l the files. Since they show up and it shows the file size, I'm not sure whether it is something I did or something that will be fixed soon.  
13:59 <@cjdelisle> http://forge.ow2.org/project/showfiles.php?group\_id=170  
14:00 <@cjdelisle> anyway I just rolled back the download page until this is fixed and I'm going to get something to eat.

14:20 <vmassol> back  
14:20 <vmassol> ah cool ui tests back to 3 failing tests  
14:20 <vmassol> hmm so my fix for SectionTest didn't work… back to drawing board  
14:31 <@cjdelisle> vmassol: you know that it fails reliably when all tests are run right?  
14:35 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:38 <@cjdelisle> mflorea: is there anything you want to fill in re pdf export? http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise31M1#HOpenOfficebaseddocumentexport  
14:38 <vmassol> cjdelisle: ok I'll try that and remove tests by test to find the issue  
14:38 <@cjdelisle> Your change was one of the only notible features in M1  
14:39 <@cjdelisle> hmm that sounds like a good solution  
14:39 <@cjdelisle> I was a bit sunk for ideas myself  
14:40 <vmassol> TBH I'm a bit worried since when running one test 300 times in a row several times, I got different errors....  
14:40 <vmassol> (worried about making it easy to write reliable tests)  
14:40 <+mflorea> cjdelisle: actually there are two different features: export as odt (and other office formats) and pdf export options  
14:40 <+mflorea> export as odt is in the export menu  
14:41 <vmassol> in the mail I mentioned earlier, I'd like to propose a quarantine solution as described here: http://martinfowler.com/articles/nonDeterminism.html  
14:42 <+mflorea> I'll try to make some time to add details in the release notes

14:54 <mpaun> has quit  
14:57 <bbc581> has joined #xwiki  
15:02 <vmassol> even worse than on jenkins: running UI tests result in 22 failing tests locally…. now going to analyze the results....  
15:04 <vmassol> Denis: just got the license  
15:08 <vmassol> cjdelisle: basically all the tests for registration fail locally for me with "Unable to set useLiveValidation to false"  
15:08 <vmassol> (7 tests)  
15:09 <@cjdelisle> hmm  
15:10 <vmassol> all the invitation ones too  
15:10 <vmassol> digging  
15:10 <@cjdelisle> Oh I was peaking at top while hudson ran. AFAICT it is using about 1/3 of the processor and there is room for expansion. Unfortunately it uses maven 2 which does not allow for threading.  
15:11 <@cjdelisle> invitation tests never fail, something must be wrong/different with your setup  
15:11 <vmassol> well the funny part is that SectionTest did not fail  
15:12 <@cjdelisle> On my desktop I can get platform built in ~25 minutes with threading (hudson takes >40 minutes)  
15:23 <mpaun> has joined #xwiki  
15:25 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I see in the test: "// We have to go to sender page before any config shows up.". why is that?  
15:28 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I see in your test that you have:  
15:29 <vmassol>     @FindBy(xpath = "//input[@type='submit'][@name='formactionsac']")  
15:29 <vmassol>     private WebElement saveButton;  
15:29 <@cjdelisle> That is nolonger true, it was a hack to make upgrading easier which was horrible and a mistake so I removed it.  
15:29 <vmassol> however I don't have this submit button on the page  
15:29 <vmassol> I have:  
15:29 <vmassol> <input class="button" type="submit" name="action\_saveandcontinue" value="Save">  
15:29 <vmassol> so it cannot find it  
15:31 <@cjdelisle> It probably changed when sdumitriu changed the admin interface but since it still passed nobody took a second look.  
15:31 <vmassol> I have no clue why it's passing....  
15:31 <vmassol> s/why/how/  
15:34 <vmassol> fixing locally and hoping it'll work remotely  
15:35 <vmassol> ok passing locally now…. now we need to understand how it can pass remotely....  
15:40 <vmassol> cjdelisle: FWIW I can see on myxwiki.org that the classname is indeed "formactionsac" (myxwiki is running 3.0RC1)  
15:44 <@cjdelisle> hmm it would be cool to put sha1s on the download page to be official  
15:58 <vmassol> any idea how I can find what commit changed "formactionsac" using git?  
15:58 <vmassol> I found:  git log -Sformactionsac --all  
15:59 <vmassol> but it doesn't show the diffs  
15:59 <vmassol> maybe some --pretty  
16:00 <@cjdelisle> http://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-grep.html  
16:00 <@cjdelisle> maybe of use?  
16:01 <vmassol> found http://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-log.html  
16:01 <vmassol> reading  
16:02 <vmassol> git grep is cool but it doesn't go through the logs  
16:02 <vmassol> s/logs/history/  
16:03 <@cjdelisle> ahh  
16:03 <+Denis> vmassol: Have you get the license now ?  
16:03 <vmassol> Denis: yes  
16:04 <vmassol> I pinged you earlier  
16:04 <+Denis> missed it, sorry  
16:04 <+Denis> adium is not nice for that  
16:05 <vmassol> I updated the tools page on dev.xwiki.org  
16:05 <+Denis> fine, the first mail has been eat by the spam filter ?  
18:29 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
18:30 <@cjdelisle> hmm, the email doesn't provide enough log, I would need a longer backlog to figure out what thread is causing the hang  
18:30 <@cjdelisle> I suspect it's the same issue as before  
18:31 <vmassol> btw I reran all ui tests with the XE 3.1 snap version I downloaded from the remote repo  
18:31 <vmassol> and SectionTest deosn't fail for me  
18:31 <vmassol> I got 4 failures though  
18:32 <vmassol> http://tinycoke.com/\_6rTe39QGj630o/screen\_shot\_2011-05-03\_at\_6.31.44\_pm.png  
18:33 <@cjdelisle> have you tried running it from the command line?

18:38 <vmassol> ah I didn't do it since I needed a local build of it whih doesn't work for me right now  
18:38 <vmassol> I'll clean my local repo and rebuild just enterprise, that should do it  
18:39 <@cjdelisle> you should be able to wipe the repo and only build the tests  
18:39 <vmassol> (or I'll run it after I fix the issue with minification - I'm on it now)  
18:39 <@cjdelisle> tests should pull everything they need. They did on hudson  
18:39 <vmassol> right, indeed i don't even need to build eterprise  
18:40 <lucaa> has quit  
18:40 <@cjdelisle> That was pretty slick changing the version number so that it would start testing the release :)  
18:40 <vmassol> I think you can even override that on the command line (but not sure)  
18:48 <jvdrean> has quit  
18:48 <vmassol> ok so the pb is again that batik-js.jar has crept in again  
18:48 <vmassol> now checking  wh  
18:48 <vmassol> y

18:49 <vmassol> it's supposed to be impossible :)  
18:49 <vmassol> but I know why  
18:51 <vmassol> it's because of the removal of the <scope>runtime  
18:51 <vmassol> in plugins  
18:51 <vmassol> ok I'll fix it quickly and then work on removing the platform distribution to fix it in a better way  
18:52 <arkub> has quit  
18:53 <vmassol> cjdelisle: are the versions released in jira? are you done with the release?  
18:53 <vmassol> (prolly not since you don't have creds for updating wikimatrix ;))  
18:53 <vmassol> (and you haven't pinged me about it :))  
18:55 <@cjdelisle> the versions are updated in jira, I haven't done much as far as external publicity  
18:56 <vmassol> cjdelisle: you also need to release the version in jira  
18:56 <vmassol> hmm let me check  
18:56 <@cjdelisle> did I not?  
18:56 <vmassol> maybe it's my jira client that is out of sync  
18:57 <vmassol> indeed  
18:57 <vmassol> it's my jira client  
18:57 <vmassol> sorry  
18:57 <vmassol> I don't understand why it doesn't sync  
18:57 <vmassol> it's supposed to do it auomtatically  
18:57 <@cjdelisle> you can make it up by updating wikimatrix :)  
18:57 <vmassol> hehe  
18:57 <vmassol> I'll do it  
18:58 <@cjdelisle> btw did you see that \_professional\_ email with sha1's and a pgp signature?  
18:58 <vmassol> yes saw it  
18:58 <vmassol> a bit verbose but nice :)  
18:59 <@cjdelisle> Yea, I think having a real chain of trust is important to credibility but it's something we can tinker with.  
18:59 <vmassol> I mean we could have the sha1 on the download page  
18:59 <vmassol> and the mail could simply link to that download page  
19:00 <@cjdelisle> yup, then I need to sign the d/l page hehe  
19:01 <vmassol> :)  
19:01 <@cjdelisle> or just put a list of hashes in the mail. It's something to perfect. Most other projects do the release manager's signature -> hash -> file

19:39 <@cjdelisle> I am thinking that in the future we should have "liazons" to various publications. Kind of like I am the guy to ask if you have postgres related issues.

21:04 <mar3lis> didn't find any valuable info about using ajax in xwiki  
21:06 <mar3lis> do i need to integrate some js files?  
21:20 <+lucaa> mar3lis: prototype is there in xwiki by default, so you can use the prototype API for ajax (but you don't have to if you don't want). Apart from that, there's nothing special, it's just plain ajax like any other ajax  
21:21 <+lucaa> (this prototype I mean http://www.prototypejs.org/ )  
21:36 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
21:41 <mar3lis> what about jQuery?  
21:41 <mar3lis> i found it's .load() command  
21:42 <mar3lis> it looks that it should be easy to do that this command  
21:43 <@cjdelisle> jquery isn't in xwiki by default (prototype is) but you might be able to include it

22:01 <lucaa> has quit

22:50 <mar3lis> and have few documents of that class

22:51 <mar3lis> will all my documents of that class return the same values?  
23:12 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
23:40 <@cjdelisle> "By the end of 2006 the release of the first Beta version" is this correct?  
23:41 <@cjdelisle> started in '03, first beta in '06?  
23:42 <@sdumitriu> What? XWiki?  
23:43 <@cjdelisle> yea, that's what wikipedia has to say  
23:44 <@sdumitriu> Something like that  
23:44 <@cjdelisle> I'll look for a citation  
23:45 <@cjdelisle> I decided that instead of doing a bad job on every publication I'm going to pick 1 (wikipedia) and make the article very good.  
23:45 <@cjdelisle> btw that git pdf is interesting  
23:55 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
23:56 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: I find that understanding the internals helps understanding the porcelain, especially the tricky situations  
23:56 <@cjdelisle> yes, it always pays to know why it's doing something that would otherwise make no sense
